001package imagingbook.lib.util.bits;
002
003/**
004 * This class implements {@link BitVector} with internal 32-bit {@code int} data.
005 * @author WB
006 */
007public class BitVector32 implements BitVector {
008        
009        private static final int WL = 32;
010        
011        private final int[] data;
012        private final int length;
013        
014        public BitVector32(int length) {
015                this.length = length;
016                int n = (length % WL == 0) ? length / WL : length / WL + 1;     // word count
017                this.data = new int[n];
018        }
019        
020        public BitVector32(byte[] bytes) {
021                this(bytes.length);
022                for (int i = 0; i < bytes.length; i++) {
023                        if (bytes[i] != 0) {
024                                this.set(i);
025                        }
026                }
027        }
028        
029        public BitVector32(boolean[] bools) {
030                this(bools.length);
031                for (int i = 0; i < bools.length; i++) {
032                        this.set(i, bools[i]);
033                }
034        }
035        
036        // ---------------------------------------------------------------------
037
038        @Override
039        public int getLength() {
040                return this.length;
041        }
042        
043        @Override
044        public boolean get(int i) {
045                if (i < 0 || i >= length) {
046                        throw new IndexOutOfBoundsException("illegal index " + i);
047                }
048                final int mask = 1 << (i % WL);
049                return (data[i / WL] & mask) != 0;
050        }
051        
052        @Override
053        public void set(int i) {
054                if (i < 0 || i >= length) {
055                        throw new IndexOutOfBoundsException("illegal index " + i);
056                }
057                final int j = i / WL;   // word index
058                final int mask = 1 << (i % WL);
059                data[j] =  data[j] | mask;
060        }
061        
062        @Override
063        public void unset(int i) {
064                if (i < 0 || i >= length) {
065                        throw new IndexOutOfBoundsException("illegal index " + i);
066                }
067                final int j = i / WL;   // word index
068                final int mask = 0x01 << (i % WL);
069                data[j] =  data[j] & ~mask;
070        }
071        
072        @Override
073        public void setAll() {
074                for (int j = 0; j < data.length; j++) {
075                        data[j] = ~0;
076                }
077        }
078
079        @Override
080        public void unsetAll() {
081                for (int j = 0; j < data.length; j++) {
082                        data[j] = 0;
083                }
084        }
085        
086        @Override
087        public String toString() {
088                StringBuilder buf = new StringBuilder();
089                buf.append(BitVector32.class.getSimpleName() + "[");
090                for (int i = 0; i < length; i++) {
091                        buf.append(this.get(i) ? "1" : "0");
092                }
093                buf.append("]");
094                return buf.toString();
095        }
096        
097        //----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
098        
099//      public static void main(String[] args) {
100//              int K = 99;
101//              BitVector32 b = new BitVector32(K);
102//              
103//              System.out.println(b.toString());
104//              b.setAll();
105//              System.out.println(b.toString());
106//              b.unsetAll();
107//              System.out.println(b.toString());
108//              System.out.println();
109//              
110//              for (int i = 0; i < b.length; i++) {
111//                      b.set(i);
112//                      System.out.println(b.toString());
113//                      b.unset(i);
114//              }
115//      }
116
117}
